item.title: 加密货币公司 Consensys 称美国监管机构已结束对以太坊 2.0 的调查
item.description: 加密货币公司 Consensys 周二晚些时候在社交媒体平台 X 上发文称，美国证券交易委员会已结束对区块链协议 Ethereum 2.0 的调查。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has closed its investigation into the blockchain protocol Ethereum 2.0, cryptocurrency firm Consensys said in a post on social media platform X late on Tuesday.】

item.title: 前 OpenAI 首席科学家将创办一家新的人工智能公司
item.description: ChatGPT 制造商 OpenAI 的联合创始人兼前首席科学家伊利亚-苏茨基弗（Ilya Sutskever）周三表示，他正在创办一家新的人工智能公司。【原文：ChatGPT maker OpenAI's co-founder and former chief scientist Ilya Sutskever said on Wednesday that he was starting a new artificial intelligence company.】

item.title: 法航荷航首席执行官就喷气机停机位不足问题抨击巴黎主要机场
item.description: 法航荷航首席执行官敦促巴黎机场公司改善法国首都戴高乐机场，称喷气式飞机跑道短缺导致每天都要争夺飞机停机位，运营成本增加。【原文：Air France-KLM's CEO has urged Aeroports de Paris to improve the French capital's Charles de Gaulle airport, saying a shortage of jetways has created a daily struggle for aircraft parking spaces and higher operating costs.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克称戴尔正在为 xAI 的超级计算机组装机架
item.description: 亿万富翁埃隆-马斯克周三在社交媒体平台 X 上发文称，戴尔科技公司正在为 xAI 正在建造的超级计算机组装一半的机架。【原文：Dell Technologies is assembling half of the racks for the supercomputer that xAI is building, billionaire Elon Musk said in a post on social media platform X on Wednesday.】

item.title: 电动汽车初创公司菲斯科的美国子公司申请破产
item.description: 本周早些时候寻求破产保护的电动汽车初创公司菲斯科（Fisker）表示，其美国分公司也已于周三向特拉华州一家法院申请破产。【原文：Electric vehicle startup Fisker, which sought Chapter 11 protection earlier this week, said its U.S. units had also filed for bankruptcy in a court in Delaware on Wednesday.】

item.title: 通用电气航空航天公司为单通道喷气机开发混合动力发动机
item.description: 通用电气航空航天公司正在开发一种混合动力电动发动机，希望它能在下一个十年中期为下一代窄体喷气式飞机提供动力。【原文：GE Aerospace is developing a hybrid electric engine with the hopes it will power next-generation narrow-body jets by the middle of the next decade.】

item.title: 通用电气航空航天公司认为明年供应紧张的局面仍将持续
item.description: 通用电气航空航天集团的一位高管周三表示，尽管波音公司的生产放缓，但全球供应链明年仍将面临挑战。【原文：A GE Aerospace executive said on Wednesday global supply chains will likely remain challenged even next year, despite a production slowdown at Boeing .】

item.title: 沿秘鲁采矿走廊，大铜矿公司面临卡车拥堵的问题
item.description: 行业消息人士告诉路透社，今年铜价飙升导致从秘鲁非法矿场运铜的卡车数量激增，造成道路拥堵，引发交通事故，尤其是在天黑之后，安第斯国家重要的 "采矿走廊 "公路沿线的路况更加危险。【原文：Surging copper prices this year have brought startling growth in the number of trucks carrying copper from illegal mines in Peru, jamming roads, causing accidents and creating hazardous conditions especially after dark along the Andean country's key "mining corridor" highway, industry sources told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国联邦存款保险公司（FDIC）主席提名人可能已获选票，但确认程序可能会拖延
item.description: 克里斯蒂-戈德史密斯-罗梅罗很可能会赢得足够的选票，以确认出任美国联邦存款保险公司主席，但共和党人很可能会放慢这一进程。【原文：Christy Goldsmith Romero will likely win enough votes to be confirmed as U.S. Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation chair but Republicans are likely to slow walk the process.】

item.title: 中国批准自动驾驶初创公司 Momenta 在美国上市
item.description: 中国证券监管机构周一表示，已批准自动驾驶初创公司 Momenta Global Limited 在美国进行首次公开募股（IPO）。【原文：China's securities regulator said on Monday it has approved autonomous driving startup Momenta Global Limited's initial public offering (IPO) in the United States.】

item.title: 瑞典因纳斯达克违反监管规定罚款 960 万美元
item.description: 瑞典金融监管局在周三的一份声明中表示，由于纳斯达克斯德哥尔摩分部近年来多次不遵守交易规则，该监管局已对其处以 1 亿瑞典克朗（约合 959 万美元）的罚款。【原文：Sweden's financial supervisory authority has fined Nasdaq Stockholm 100 million Swedish crowns ($9.59 million) for not complying with bourse rules at several occasions in recent years, the regulator said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 丰田董事长的股东支持率因治理问题下滑
item.description: 在本周举行的丰田汽车年度股东大会上，丰田公司董事长丰田章男的股东支持率明显下降，认证测试丑闻和其他治理问题使他的支持率大打折扣。【原文：Toyota Chairman Akio Toyoda's level of shareholder support dropped markedly at the automaker's annual general meeting this week, hurt by certification test scandals and other governance concerns.】

item.title: Shein 面临欧盟的版权规则。这关系到什么？
item.description: 根据欧盟一项加强知识产权监督的新规定，Shein 的大量 5 美元衬衫、20 美元连衣裙和 15 美元鞋子可能面临更多的商标审查。【原文：Shein’s vast array of $5 shirts, $20 dresses and $15 shoes could face more trademark scrutiny under a new EU rule that tightens oversight on intellectual property rights.】

item.title: Just Eat 外卖在德国、奥地利和西班牙与亚马逊合作
item.description: 欧洲最大的食品外卖公司 Just Eat Takeaway 周三表示，它已达成协议，为德国、奥地利和西班牙的亚马逊 Prime 会员提供 15 欧元（约合 16.13 美元）以上食品订单的免费配送服务。【原文：Europe's biggest food delivery firm Just Eat Takeaway said on Wednesday it has struck a deal to offer Amazon Prime members in Germany, Austria and Spain free delivery of food orders above 15 euros ($16.13).】

item.title: 消息人士称，凯蒂-佩里支持的食品公司布拉格正在探索出售事宜
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，由名人凯蒂-佩里（Katy Perry）和奥兰多-布鲁姆（Orlando Bloom）支持的 Bragg Live Food Products 公司正在探讨出售事宜，包括债务在内，这家苹果醋生产商的估值可能超过 5 亿美元。【原文：Bragg Live Food Products, which is backed by celebrities Katy Perry and Orlando Bloom, is exploring a sale that could value the maker of apple cider vinegar at more than $500 million, including debt, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国年中电商节优惠延长，电商热情受挫
item.description: 业内专家称，中国的年中电子商务促销节未能激起购物者的极大热情，尽管各大平台将优惠期延长至数周，以在经济前景黯淡的情况下吸引勒紧裤腰带的消费者。【原文：China's mid-year e-commerce sales festival failed to stir up a great deal of excitement among shoppers, industry experts said, even as major platforms extended offers to a weeks-long period to woo belt-tightening consumers amid a gloomy economic outlook.】

item.title: 独家报道消息人士称，凯撒董事长将返回深圳与监管机构会面
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的消息人士称，违约的中国开发商凯撒集团董事长近十年来首次从香港返回中国大陆，以获得监管部门对离岸债务重组的批准。【原文：The chairman of defaulted Chinese developer Kaisa Group returned to mainland China from Hong Kong for the first time in almost a decade to get regulatory approval for an offshore debt restructuring, two sources familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 西捷航空公司因预计工会罢工开始取消航班
item.description: 西捷航空（WestJet）周三表示，该公司已开始取消和合并航班，为西捷航空飞机维修工程师和其他技术运营员工的罢工行动做准备。【原文：WestJet said on Wednesday it has started cancelling and consolidating flights as it prepares for strike action from WestJet Aircraft Maintenance Engineers and other Tech Ops employees.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息称法拉利首款电动汽车售价超过 50 万美元
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的消息人士告诉路透社，法拉利的首款电动汽车售价至少为 50 万欧元（约合 53.5 万美元），这家豪华汽车制造商正准备开设一家工厂生产该车型，并可能将集团产量最多提高三分之一。【原文：Ferrari's first electric car will cost at least 500,000 euros ($535,000), a source familiar with the matter told Reuters, as the luxury automaker prepares to open a plant that will make the model - and could boost group production by up to a third.】

item.title: 早间竞标：英国通胀考验等待市场繁荣
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 国营媒体报道：中国汽车制造商寻求对欧盟汽车征收报复性关税
item.description: 国家支持的《环球时报》周三称，布鲁塞尔决定对中国电动汽车出口实施限制，中国汽车制造商敦促中国政府通过提高进口欧洲汽油动力汽车的关税来进行报复。【原文：Chinese automakers have urged Beijing to retaliate against Brussels' decision to place curbs on Chinese electric vehicle exports by raising tariffs on imported European gasoline-powered cars, the state-backed Global Times newspaper said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因科技股反弹和美联储降息赌注而上涨
item.description: 受科技股反弹的提振，亚洲股市周三升至三周来的最高点，而在疲软的美国零售销售数据强化了美联储今年晚些时候降息的预期之后，美元出现了震荡。【原文：Asian shares rose to their highest in three weeks on Wednesday, buoyed by a rally in tech stocks, while the dollar wobbled after soft U.S. retail sales data reinforced expectations of the Federal Reserve cutting rates later this year.】

item.title: 美元走稳；英镑在通胀测试前下跌
item.description: 周三，在疲软的美国零售销售数据强化了美联储即将降息的押注之后，美元收跌，而英镑则在当天晚些时候的英国通胀数据公布之前略有回落。【原文：The dollar was nursing losses on Wednesday after soft U.S. retail sales data reinforced bets of imminent Federal Reserve rate cuts, while sterling eased a touch ahead of a reading on UK inflation due later in the day.】

item.title: 战争焦虑超过美国原油库存意外增加，原油步步上扬
item.description: 周三早盘，石油小幅上涨，因为对欧洲和中东冲突升级的担忧抵消了美国原油库存意外增加后的需求担忧。【原文：Oil rose slightly in early trade on Wednesday as concern over escalating conflict in Europe and the Middle East offset demand worries following an unexpected build in U.S. crude inventories.】

item.title: 日元疲软提振日本 5 月出口增长
item.description: 由于日元疲软有助于提高日本商品的竞争力，日本 5 月份的出口在运往美国的汽车和运往中国的芯片制造机械的推动下大幅增长。【原文：Japanese exports rose sharply in May driven by U.S.-bound shipments of cars and China-bound chip-making machinery as the weak yen helps make its goods more competitive.】

item.title: 法院裁定，有关美国信用卡滞纳金规定的诉讼必须留在得克萨斯州
item.description: 本周二，美国消费者金融保护局（U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau）在一宗挑战其信用卡滞纳金上限为 8 美元的新规定的诉讼中遭遇司法权挫折，联邦上诉法院认为该案应留在得克萨斯州，而不应移交给华盛顿特区的法官。【原文：The U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau on Tuesday suffered a jurisdictional setback in a lawsuit challenging its new rule capping credit card late fees at $8 when a federal appeals court held the case should stay in Texas and not be sent to a judge in Washington, D.C.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国推动荷兰和日本限制向中国出口更多芯片制造设备
item.description: 一位熟悉内情的人士周二告诉路透社，一位美国官员在与荷兰政府会晤后将前往日本，以推动盟国进一步打击中国生产尖端半导体的能力。【原文：A U.S. official was headed to Japan after meeting with the Dutch government in an effort to push allies to further crack down on China's ability to produce cutting-edge semiconductors, a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞标：警惕通货紧缩的自满情绪
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 特朗普媒体称美国证券交易委员会的决定可能有助于其获得 2.47 亿美元的资金
item.description: Trump Media & Technology Group 周二表示，美国证券交易委员会已宣布该公司转售部分股票和认股权证的申请生效，这可能给该公司带来约 2.47 亿美元的收益。【原文：Trump Media & Technology Group said on Tuesday the Securities and Exchange Commission has declared effective the company's filing for resale of certain shares and warrants, potentially giving it about $247 million in proceeds.】

item.title: 产品日落之后，苹果转向第三方提供 "先买后付 "服务
item.description: 虽然苹果公司将停止去年推出的 "先买后付 "服务，但该公司仍在坚持这一产品，今年晚些时候将通过 Affirm 等第三方推出该服务的后续产品。【原文：Although Apple is discontinuing its buy now, pay later service launched last year, the company is sticking with the product, with a successor to the offering launching later this year via third-parties like Affirm .】
